file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 29-10-12-04 - SAMPLING VALVE (PRESSURE RETURN) - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL SAMPLING VALVE (PRESSURE RETURN) - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the sampling valves. B. There are two sampling valves (pressure and return) installed in each hydraulic manifold. The removal/installation procedures are equivalent for them. C. You can get access to the sampling valve of system 1 through access panel 193BL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). D. You can get access to the sampling valve of system 2 through access panel 193CR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). E. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 29-10-12-000-801-A SAMPLING VALVES - REMOVAL ALL 29-10-12-400-801-A SAMPLING VALVES - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 29-10-12 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 29-10-12-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. SAMPLING VALVES - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the sampling valves. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 193 193BL Hydraulic compartment of system 1 193 193CR Hydraulic compartment of system 2 D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Hydraulic compartment of system 1 and 1 Does the task system 2 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 29-10-12 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the ELEC PUMP 1 and (or) ELEC PUMP 2 circuit breaker(s) and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it (them). (2) Fully release the pressure from the related hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (3) Remove access panel 193BL and (or) 193CR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A WARNING:THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM CONTAINS PHOSPHATE-ESTER HYDRAULIC FLUID. THE FLUID CAN CAUSE IRRITATION IN YOUR SKIN OR INJURY TO YOUR EYES. USE THE APPLICABLE GOGGLES AND RUBBER GLOVES. IF THE FLUID TOUCHES YOU, FLUSH YOUR SKIN WITH WATER. IF IT GETS IN YOUR EYES, FLUSH THEM WITH WATER AND GET MEDICAL HELP. (1) Remove the cap screws (4) from the fluid-sampling valve assemblies (1). (2) Remove the fluid-sampling valve assemblies (1) from the filter manifold. (3) Remove and discard the O-ring (2) and backups (3) from the fluid-sampling valve assemblies. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 29-10-12 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 29-10-12-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. SAMPLING VALVES - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the sampling valves. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200 HTS AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-803-A/200 HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - BLEED OF AIR IPC 29-10-07 MANIFOLD C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 193 193BL Hydraulic compartment of system 1 193 193CR Hydraulic compartment of system 2 D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the hands 1 available Fluid-Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles, Phosphate Ester- Protection for the eyes 1 available Base, Fluid-Resistant F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) O-ring IPC 29-10-07 1/LRU Backup IPC 29-10-07 2/LRU H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Hydraulic compartment of system 1 and 1 Does the task system 2 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 29-10-12 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the O-ring (2) and backups (3) on the fluid-sampling valve assembly. (2) Install the fluid-sampling valve assembly (1) in the filter manifold with four cap screws (4). Torque cap screws to 1.1 to 1.5 N.m (10 to 13 lb.in). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the ELEC PUMP 1 and (or) ELEC PUMP 2 circuit breaker(s) and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it (them). (2) Pressurize the related hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200) and make sure that there are no leaks in the sampling valves. (3) Bleed the air from the hydraulic system lines ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-803-A/200). (4) Install access panel 193BL and (or) 193CR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100).
